pullRequest.title: [GEOS-9773] Allow internal GWC to tile WMS requests that don't contain TILED=TRUE in the request parameters
pullRequest.bodyText:
If we have enabled the direct integration in geoserver we have to explicitly add TILED=True to requests sent from the client to have GWC kick in.
This makes it very difficult to introduce caching for clients which we do not control or legacy ones.
We would rather have an additional checkback in the "Caching Defaults" page right below Enable direct integration with GeoServer WMS that:
Has title "Explicitly require TILED Parameter"
By default is checked
If unchecked, in case clients do not send the TILED parameter they behave like it is sent and set to True.
This allows clients to explicitly unset it for certain requests by setting it to False.

Wondering, is this object stored using XStream? I have vague memories that XStream dodges the normal construction mechanism and ends up ignoring field initializers too. I would give it a look.
Believe that normally we use Boolean object wrapper, and in the getter, if null, return the desired default value... at least, that's what we do for CatalogInfo objects :-D
Confused, if the new setting affecting capabilities results at all?
